The diagram depicts two separate tables describing the number of networks and hosts per network for each class.

Table 1

Class A.
First Octet: Network.
Second Octet: Host.
Third Octet: Host.
Fourth Octet: Host.
Subnet Mask: 255.0.0.0 or /8.

Class B.
First Octet: Network.
Second Octet: Network.
Third Octet: Host.
Fourth Octet: Host.
Subnet Mask: 255.255.0.0 or /16.

Class C
First Octet: Network.
Second Octet: Network.
Third Octet: Network.
Fourth Octet: Host
Subnet Mask: 255.255.255.0 or /24.

Table 2

Address Class: Class A.
First Octet Range: 0 to 127.
Number of Possible Networks: 128 (2 are reserved).
Number of Hosts per Network: 16,777,214.

Address Class: Class B.
First Octet Range: 128 to 191.
Number of Possible Networks: 16,348.
Number of Hosts per Network: 65,534.

Address Class: Class C.
First Octet Range: 192 to 223.
Number of Possible Networks: 2,097,152.
Number of Hosts per Network: 254.
